is-dc-loss.title: In Situ Net Terrestrial Carbon Stock Loss
is-dc-loss.description: Positive values indicate a loss (decrease) of terrestrial carbon stocks (organic matter stored on land), including above- and below-ground biomass in ecosystems and biomass contained in anthropogenic products (lumber, cattle, etc.).

is-dc-loss-std.title: In Situ Net Terrestrial Carbon Stock Loss std
is-dc-loss-std.description: Positive values indicate a loss (decrease) of terrestrial carbon stocks (organic matter stored on land), including above- and below-ground biomass in ecosystems and biomass contained in anthropogenic products (lumber, cattle, etc.).

is-nbe.title: In Situ Net Biosphere Exchange
is-nbe.description: Net flux of carbon from the terrestrial biosphere to the atmosphere due to biomass burning (BB) and Reco minus gross primary production (GPP). It includes both anthropogenic processes (e.g., deforestation, reforestation, farming) and natural processes (e.g., climate-variability-induced carbon fluxes, disturbances, recovery from disturbances).

is-nbe-std.title: In Situ Net Biosphere Exchange std
is-nbe-std.description: Net flux of carbon from the terrestrial biosphere to the atmosphere due to biomass burning (BB) and Reco minus gross primary production (GPP). It includes both anthropogenic processes (e.g., deforestation, reforestation, farming) and natural processes (e.g., climate-variability-induced carbon fluxes, disturbances, recovery from disturbances.

is-nce.title: In Situ Terrestrial Net Carbon Exchange
is-nce.description: Net flux of carbon from the surface to the atmosphere. For land, NCE can be defined as sum of NBE and fossil fuel and cement emissions.

is-nce-std.title: In Situ Terrestrial Net Carbon Exchange std
is-nce-std.description: Net flux of carbon from the surface to the atmosphere. For land, NCE can be defined as sum of NBE and fossil fuel and cement emissions.

lnlg-nce.title: Land Nadir and Land Glint Terrestrial Net Carbon Exchange
lnlg-nce.description: Net flux of carbon from the surface to the atmosphere. For land, NCE can be defined as sum of NBE and fossil fuel and cement emissions.

lnlg-nce-std.title: Land Nadir and Land Glint Terrestrial Net Carbon Exchange std
lnlg-nce-std.description: Net flux of carbon from the surface to the atmosphere. For land, NCE can be defined as sum of NBE and fossil fuel and cement emissions.

lnlgis-nce.title: Land Nadir, Land Glint and In Situ Terrestrial Net Carbon Exchange
lnlgis-nce.description: Net flux of carbon from the surface to the atmosphere. For land, NCE can be defined as sum of NBE and fossil fuel and cement emissions.

river.title: Lateral River Flux
river.description: The lateral flux of carbon in (positive) or out (negative) of a region transported by the water cycle.

river-std.title: Lateral River Flux std
river-std.description: The lateral flux of carbon in (positive) or out (negative) of a region transported by the water cycle.

wood.title: Lateral Wood Flux
wood.description: The lateral flux of carbon in (positive) or out (negative) of a region due to wood product harvesting and usage.

wood-std.title: Lateral Wood Flux std
wood-std.description: The lateral flux of carbon in (positive) or out (negative) of a region due to wood product harvesting and usage.

crop.title: Lateral Crop Flux
crop.description: The lateral flux of carbon in (positive) or out (negative) of a region due to agriculture.

crop-std.title: Lateral Crop Flux std
crop-std.description: The lateral flux of carbon in (positive) or out (negative) of a region due to agriculture.

ff.title: Fossil Fuel and Cement Emissions
ff.description: The burning of fossil fuels and release of carbon due to cement production, representing a flux of carbon from the land surface (geologic reservoir) to the atmosphere.

ff-std.title: Fossil Fuel and Cement Emissions std
ff-std.description: The burning of fossil fuels and release of carbon due to cement production, representing a flux of carbon from the land surface (geologic reservoir) to the atmosphere.
